trans-unit.source: An asset is a representation of an element of your game inside Game Studio, such as a texture, animation, or model.
trans-unit.target: An asset is a representation of an element of your game inside Game Studio, such as a texture, animation, or model.

trans-unit.source: Some assets require resource files. For example, texture assets need image files and audio assets need audio files. Other types of assets (such as scenes, physics colliders, and game settings) don't use resource files, and can be created entirely in Game Studio.
trans-unit.target: Some assets require resource files. For example, texture assets need image files and audio assets need audio files. Other types of assets (such as scenes, physics colliders, and game settings) don't use resource files, and can be created entirely in Game Studio.

trans-unit.source: You can compile and optimize assets with a special compiler provided by Stride. Compiled assets are packed together as reusable bundles.
trans-unit.target: You can compile and optimize assets with a special compiler provided by Stride. Compiled assets are packed together as reusable bundles.

trans-unit.source: Assets displayed in the Asset View
trans-unit.target: Assets displayed in the Asset View

trans-unit.source: create and browse assets in the Asset View
trans-unit.target: create and browse assets in the Asset View

trans-unit.source: import existing assets, such as FBX files
trans-unit.target: import existing assets, such as FBX files

trans-unit.source: edit assets in the property editor
trans-unit.target: edit assets in the property editor

trans-unit.source: see a live preview in the Asset Preview
trans-unit.target: see a live preview in the Asset Preview
